subject: Re: [junit] testXXXX must return void?
msgSnippet: ... The result of the test would be nothing happens if it passes or an exception if not. Does that suffice? If not, what else do you want to do with the
messageBody:
On Monday 23 June 2003 18:43, areider wrote:
> I would like to write test methods that I can reuse outside of junit,
> where I would want to inspect the result of the test. Right now I'm
> faced with writing the methods twice.

The result of the test would be "nothing happens" if it passes or an
exception if not.
Does that suffice?
If not, what else do you want to do with the "test result"?

Robert
